abstract: International Criminal Court opens witness tampering trial involving Jean-Pierre Bemba, former vice president of Democratic Republic of Congo, and four of his associates; Bemba is awaiting verdict from another ICC trial regarding crimes committed by his militia in Central African Republic; latest litigation accuses Bemba and others of bribing witnesses to testify favorably at war crimes case.
lead_paragraph: A former vice president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, Jean-Pierre Bemba, and four others are charged with corrupting testimony in Mr. Bemba’s war crimes case.

headline.main: War Crimes Court Opens Trial on Congolese Witness Tampering
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; The Hague: Tampering Trial Starts for Ex-Vice President of Congo

snippet: A former vice president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, Jean-Pierre Bemba, and four others are charged with corrupting testimony in Mr. Bemba’s war crimes case.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
